reviewText:
- Ugly textures compensated by the fact that it is meant to be really dark
- Shoddy stamina system
- 'Collect x items to unlock door & then run around a bland maze because now there is a monster chasing you' gameplay
- Unpleasant trap design (the ghostly arms which just seem to shake the character around violently for ages & not
responding to keypresses or just randomly responding).

Can't recommend as even a sale pick-up, definitely not at this price.
voteText: 40 of 46 people (87%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Can't recommend the game, it feels totally cheap when I played it.
But it costs 13 bucks while games like Slender were totally free and a lot scarier in my honest opinion.

Well, I have to admit I played it without VR, maybe the implementation of VR does justify the price. But I guess not even with VR it would be scary.

The monsters feel cheap, the game totally feels not immersive. This is not horror, it's not scary at all. You can just stay there, watch the monster coming to you and you don't even have the wish to run away. More like: Come over here, I wanna see what bad animation you do when you arrive.

There is no tension, you just want to shut the game on the next spot you die.

I'm gonna refund.
